node.text:
Super proud of our turmeric harvest this season! Our goal this year was to take a third of our harvest to market, save a third for re-planting, and process a third to make powder. We ended up having way more than expected and decided to pot up the rest to sell as live plants in the spring. What makes this season unique is that we only directly fed them once by adding minerals from @azomite and worm castings to the soil before planting. A major factor in their robust growth was that we topped the soil off with organic matter in the form of decaying hay which fed microorganisms slowly throughout the season. We believe our sandy soil played a large contribution in allowing the rhizomes to develop and are ready for a larger production come spring. 

What are some of your goals for next growing season? Let us know! 🙌🏾🌱💯💚✨
•
•
•
#turmeric #farming #regenerativeagriculture #notill #permaculture #regenerativefarming #gardening #smallscalefarming #blackfarmers #growingfood #learning #education #goals #tallahassee #growyourown #harvest #sustainable #alkaline

node.text:
Update on my miracle Sweet Pepper plants from @rawlivingsa - not only are they surviving, but striving! Tons of peppers popping out everywhere, having to add in supports around each one so they don’t bend over and break off. The misting system that was installed in the greenhouse also help them get enough humidity which I definitely recommend if you’ve struggled with peppers in the past. Trimmed the tops to stop them growing taller. Cant wait to pick the first decent sized pepper 🫑

#sweetpeppers #peppers #multicolour #ediblegarden #greenhouse #growing #grow #food #veggies #plants #planters #green #organic #growyourown #food #backyardboerdery #smallscalefarming #happyplace #greenfingers

node.text:
This post is from Summer 2020; yet, the bushes are just as vibrant...
::
Reposted from @bournebrilliantco The lil #greenlizards love #lemongrass just as much as we!  Another of our bushes this one is only 5 mos old. The bush in the previous pic was planted on this property 14 yrs ago as a few sprigs by THE Mom. Yearly, it never really dies! Even while it may look frost-bitten or brown during the winter we use the leaves in whatever condition we gather them. The greener the plant; the more fragrant and potent though (keep that in mind). We'll talk about the benefits in the next post (promise); just note that lemongrass deffly smells like 🍋s. The taste... ermmm, well... 🤔😅😊 #eatthegrass #pickandeat #herbalmedicine #yourbodyneedsthis #lemongrasstea

#didyouknow beets contain a high concentration of nitrates, which have a blood pressure-lowering effect. This may lead to a reduced risk of heart attacks, heart failure and stroke. This simple addition to your diet can help you stay fit and healthy, and are absolutely delish !
.
.
.
.
.

node.text:
Microgreens are baby plants harvested just after the cotyledon leaves have developed. The seeds used for microgreen are the same as those for growing regular veg, the difference being that they’re planted in denser quantity. We’ve been experimenting with a variety of different kinds such as beetroot, mustard , bok choy, clover, komatsuna, basil, radish, pea shoots and sunflower. Even trying our hand at growing them outdoors instead of in trays indoors, and we’ve seen quite a variety enjoy the chilly weather.
.
.
.
.
.
.

node.text:
There are actually two of these guys, Harry and Larry are the newest additions at @the_frenchiefarm

@farmstandrevival’s NEWEST Featured Farm: 👍 @the_frenchiefarm

“Frenchie Farm is an organic and regenerative family farm raising Nigerian Dwarf goats, Great Pyrenees, and pasture raised chickens, ducks, and broiler chickens. We provide farm classes for kids dedicated to teaching children about sustainable farming. Frenchie Farm also sells seasonally appropriate farm-to-table goods, including but not limited to, pasture raised chicken + duck eggs, pasture raised broiler chickens, honey, and seasonal produce.”

In an effort to live a more simplified life with intention and gratitude, our family made the decision to pursue modern homesteading. We grow as much of our own food as possible in our garden while also raising Nigerian Dwarf goats, chickens, and bees.”

Chicago, Illinois
📸: @the_frenchiefarm
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Join the movement! 👩‍🌾 👍 Let’s Revive Small Local Farms 🙌🏻 We feature small regenerative growers 👩‍🌾 👨‍🌾 from around the world! 🥕

Unser Koriander während der Blackout-Phase. 
Die bekannte saftige grüne Farbe bekommen die Microgreens erst anschließend in der Reifephase unter dem Licht. 
Besonders gut eignet sich Koriander für asiatische und auch mexikanische Küche. Hier scheiden sich natürlich die kulinarischen Geister aber wir finden diesen intensiven Geschmack bei den dafür passenden Gerichten einfach hervorragend.🌱

node.text:
PEASANT........
What do you feel when you hear that word? 
As an allotment holder, a community gardener, a small scale food grower, I hear a word that connects me. 
Connects me to the small scale farmers that feed 70% of the worlds population. 
Connects me to small scale farmers across the UK, working agroecologically, and supporting the planet as well as their communities.
It connects me to the incredible community gardeners across the globe, growing food in their communities for their communities.
It connects me to allotment holders and the allotment movement.
It connects me to land justice, food justice and social justice campaigns and warriors.
It connects me to land.
It connects me to nature.
Let’s change the narrative....
Let’s be proud of our links to small, local farmers and really engage with both the land and the fight to keep that land in local hands, and under local control.
.
.
.
#peasant #peasantfarming #laviacampesina #allotmentwarrior #landjustice #foodjustice #socialjusticewarrior #gardenactivist #humanswhogrowfood #smallscalefarming #growyourownfood #allotmentgardening #communitygarden #communitygardening #feedyourcommunity #growfornature #landworkersunite #foodsovereignty #seedsovereignty #bethechangeyouwanttosee #ediblelandscapes #inourhands #mondaysthoughts #mytinygarden

node.text:
The quality and variety of produce heading our way from @rolypolyfarm is just so good. One of the many things on offer from their patch this week is shiso. 

According to The Guardian, "The taste is hard to pin down – it is in the mint family and there’s definitely a strong note of that, as well as coriander, basil, cinnamon, anise, something a little perfumed and a hint of citrus. It’s odd and not like anything else, but it is quickly very addictive."

Popular in Japan, Korea, Vietnam and China, it goes really well with fish, rice, eggs, in soup and in veg dishes, and makes an excellent addition to mojitos.

Available on the order form this week, which is still open for a few more hours! Have a look at our website for a link to the form and to see what else is on offer.

Pic taken from @rolypolyfarm Instagram
.
.

node.text:
The #flowerfeedflourish  project🧑🏻‍🌾☀️The holidays are here...bring on the ‘Good Cheer’ and the memories of sharing traditional meals together! Your invited to join me in donating produce this ‘Holiday Season’ to those in need, as we navigate this pandemic -  maybe for an out of work neighbor, community shelter and/or local food bank. This social art project is a hunger action initiative and advocate of regenerative agriculture. As we confront the Covid pandemic together, I hope you’ll join us to help raise awareness about the increased risk of hunger and poverty in domestic and international communities during this unprecedented time. What’s in your donation basket? ☀️👩‍🌾💚🌎

 #zerohunger #growandgive #organicfarm #farmtotable #farmfresh #ampleharvest
#regenerativefarming #farm #farmer #gardenactivist #homegrown #organic  #smallscalefarming #sustainability #regenerativeagriculture #healthyeating #foodblogger #smallscalefarmimg #holisticfarm #holisticgarden #veggies #organicfarm #fao #organic #flowerfarmer  #organicgardenermag #dahlias #flowers #socialart

node.text:
Hard for me to believe this was already 6 months ago! Been looking back at photos to help remember when plantings were blooming etc. This was close to the end of anemone/ranunculus season, I’m planting four times the amount of anemones and ranunculus I did last year and am already looking forward to sharing their beauty in the early spring. I have been building more rock raised beds and as I’m doing the fictionally hard and dirty work I am dreaming about what will fill them in only a few short months. Planning next season’s garden feels very satisfying to me at the moment! Especially when Ira hands me a sprouted Ranunculus corm and then claps his hands as I plant it in the soil🌱🌿✨
.
.
.
Lovely photo taken by the lovely Milla @thewomanwhomarriedabear 
#farmerflorist #smallscalefarming #womenwhofarm #childhoodunplugged #seasonalflowers #pnwflowers #slowflowers #dancingflowerfarm

node.text: I harvested tons of fennel for a big new batch of Fennel Herb Salts. This coming week I will have a ✨NEW✨ Holiday section on my Farm Store. There will be 7 Herb Salt Flavours, Herbal Teas, Eucalyptus (I grew it!!) Botanical Bath salts and of course the non-perishable pantry items 🏄🏿‍♀️ My back is on the mend and I was lucky that a friend is helping me with harvesting this week so I have re-opened the Farm Store after I said I was going to close it to heal my back. This Friday I will have lots of new items and cool news too!

node.text:
Shop local hits a different tune in 2020. 
🏦🏪🏢🏬💵
Remember LOCAL business owners are your neighbors. 😃 LOCAL BUSINESSES bring innovation and growth to YOUR 👈 community. They make your community unique and different. 
🍾🎄🕎 🎉
Here are some tips you can do, to help spread some love this holiday season to your local businesses.

1️⃣ Snag some local swag for gifts! Check out one of my favorite local lines at @gfccns_life_style 👕 

2️⃣ Fill them socks up with Gift Cards from some local restaurants! I refuse to start my day without some bean from @reprisecoffeeroasters ☕️ 

3️⃣ Get lazy and order out often, if you can. Treat yourself, coworkers, or family to some local pizza. Try @pizzadevilledelivery near us for some amazing vegan ZA. 🍕 
❤️ 📈💪
Keep your community strong and keep local businesses in your mind this season.
🌱
Please SUPPORT US by LIKING & FOLLOWING this page.
❤️🌱 
Stay tuned for our next harvest! 
🌱

node.text:
It all begins with the cocoa beans in the pod...there are about 20 to 50 cocoa beans in a pod. The outer layer is cream coloured and sweet to taste...a bit like vanilla but try not to bite into the purple inner layer as it is very bitter in taste.

Here a farmer from Springboard Nigeria shows us the insides of a cocoa pod

#cocoapod #enterprisenation #smallscalefarming #cocoa #cocoabeans #womeninchocolate #beantobar #howmanyseedsinacocoapod #chocolatemaker #chocolateoyin #chocolate #vegan #rainforest #chocolatebegins #chocolatebeginswithcocoabeans #chocolatefacts

Less than 4 weeks until Christmas 🤩 If you’ve not yet placed your order for one of our KellyBronze Turkeys or Norfolk Geese, then there is still time, though we would advise ordering soon to ensure we’re able to supply the size you would like.

Every turkey & goose comes with full cooking instructions, and our turkeys are faster cooking than most other breeds, which helps make for an enjoyable & stress free Christmas!

You can place your order via our online shop and we have collection points across Kent. Where possible, we do ask for payment to be made in full at the time of ordering as this will help us to make sure our collection points are as contactless and efficient as possible!

If you have any queries about ordering, please do give us a call on 01580 291792.

node.text:
My German Thyme patch is looking fine and fancy in the crisp autumn air.  Such a wonderfully aromatic and tasty herb.  Not only do I use Thyme as a culinary herb, but I use it in herbal tea blends and bath soaks.  Thyme helps clear up respiratory infections, eases sore throats, is good for oral health, is anti-inflammatory, promotes healthy bones, is more antibacterial than lavender oil, promotes healthy cardiovascular system, used as a sleep aid, etc. 
#thyme #herbgardening #herbs #medicinalplants #culinaryherbs #aromaticplants #tea #bathsoak #growyourownfood #backyardgardens #smallscalefarming #zone6bgarden

node.text:
Our latest blog post is up!

Part 2 of our 3 part series, Food Access explores the basic requirements for food to be accessible and looks into the personal perspective on what it means to "not have". It provides sustainable solutions for the world we all know is possible. 

Tune in! Link in bio 😁

Trivia question: Doe anyone else remember FoodLand on the West Side of #Detroit ?

node.text:
Who else has snow on their tunnels? Beautiful winter scene from @tastyacrescolorado!  Also checkout their helpful tip below. ⬇️

"When the storm clears, these @farmersfriendllc end wall kits make ventilating a breeze. ❄️💨☀️

Pro tip: use the #dutchdoor on your primary entrance, & then install the #zipperdoor “backwards” at the other end so you can open & close it from *inside* the warm, dry tunnel." 

Thanks for sharing @tastyacrescolorado!
.
.
.

node.text:
It's no secret that the BB's have been sipping on warm lemongrass tea from the ages of 1+y. In fact, a lot of basic herbal teas are safe for the entire family (rules apply though)! I've been growing my own #lemongrass for about 14y and even if you never eat or drink this very vital bush; please take a moment to note the MANY uses for the blades...
::
Now, I ask (as I always just wonder; no judgment... just wondering really): why are you buying commercial grade (prolly fake or mixed with water or isopropyl) lemongrass (& other herb) oils when it is so very easy to grow your own! This can be invasive; so, it's easy to cultivate. We were nomadic for 3y and the bushes practiced self-care ...😅😩😯... and even multiplied! I'm sitting here thinking of the countless folks who've started their bushes from cutlings of mine... #getintoaction #bushtea #youcandothisathome #growityourself #naturalantibacterial

node.text:
Chicken processing day!!!
.
I didn’t include any photos more graphic than raw plucked chickens, but if this isn’t your thing, just keep scrolling. 😆
.
We started at 8:30 in the morning, took a 30 min break for lunch and put the last load in the freezer at 4:30. It was a very long day!!!
.
All the kids other than Madie (our 3 year old) helped out. Ethan (12) and Lauren (10) helped with plucking while Noah (8) and Emma (6) helped with bringing the chickens one at a time from the coop as we were ready fir them.  I didn’t expect that they would stick with us most of the day, but they did! #proudmommymoment #hardworkingkidsrock 
.
Our goal is to grow enough food to feed our family for a whole year. (Or purchase it from other small farms in the area) #supportyourlocalfarmer
.
The idea is daunting, but we are determined to get as close to that goal as we possibly can.  We eat a lot of chicken, and to be honest, I have struggled with this step for quite a long time. 
.
Conventionally grown chickens are grown in HORRIBLE conditions, fed a unhealthy diet and most never see sunshine a day in their life.
.
Growing our own chickens not only allows us to stop supporting that abusive  industry, but it also allows for us to know that the chickens had a wonderful life on green grass and sunshine, eating lots of bugs and supplemented with organic feed. 
.
It’s going to be difficult leaving behind the convenience of #costcorotisseriechicken, but knowing that we are not only consuming a healthier product but also treating our birds well, is 100% with it. 💛
.
#onestepatatime #beyondorganic #smallscalefarming #healthyfood #knowwhereyourfoodcomesfrom #animalstewardship #healthychickens #growenoughfoodforayear #meatchickens #butcheringday

La production 2021 sera assurément originale!

node.text:
Here is a great idea for a Christmas present for your gardener family member or friend. The 2021 Celestial Planting Calendar features a couple of small articles that I wrote about fruit tree planting and Lunar Wood. We offer the calendar through our online store.
.
I've been following the calendar since 2005 and over all these years I've experienced positive changes in plant germination and growth, less weed growth, and when the food was harvested accordingly, it stayed better in winter storage. The biodynamic teachings from my mom (and Titia Posthuma, Rosemary Tayler and many others), the books of Johanna Paungger, and using permaculture principles has all helped me to grow our farm into a sustainable and regenerative place, where the teachings and observations help us gain insight into challenges and solutions. 
And so this calendar is a vital tool for my farm work as well as for my health. 
. 
.
.
#thymeagaingardens #farmlife #happyfarmer #sustainablefarming #smallscalefarming #permaculturefarm #regenerativeagriculture #biodynamicfarming #lunarcalendar #mooncalendar #biodynamicgarden #humanscalefarming #connecttotheland #princeedwardcounty

node.text:
Butcher day is hard. Even though we know it’s coming and are prepared, it’s emotional.

I know it’s controversial but we name our livestock. 
Because we are hands on with each of them from the day they arrive, or are born here, until their last day, it would be more difficult to force a disconnect. We know who likes to be scratched where and who wants to eat next to whom; who’s going to lag behind the herd and who’s sleeping where. 

So yes, butcher day is hard. But we know their time with us was the best it could be. And the cycle continues as they nourish us.

node.text:
Nachdem wir genügend Kaffeesatz gesammelt haben, besteht der erste Schritt beim Anbau von Austernpilzlinge darin, den Kaffeesatz mit einem anderen üblichen landwirtschaftlichen Nebenprodukt zu vermischen: gehäckseltes Stroh.

Das richtige Verhältnis zu finden, war ein interessanter Prozess. Das Austernpilzmyzel kann beide Materialien sehr gut verdauen, aber ein Substrat mit zu viel Kaffee wird zu dicht und hemmt das Myzelwachstum, und zu wenig reduziert unseren Ertrag pro Sack. Wir haben jetzt ein Verhältnis gefunden, das sehr gut funktioniert, und wir hoffen, in den kommenden Monaten sehr grosse Ernten zu erzielen 👍👍

node.text:
National Tree Week 🌳 ⠀
⠀
At Maple Farm Kelsale we practice regenerative organic farming and agroforestry. We want to farm with nature, and as part of that, leave plenty of space for nature. We were early pioneers of agroforestry, having long planted rows of trees within our fields. These trees will one day provide valuable timber and woodland fruits like nuts or apples. Meanwhile, they contribute to the maintenance of optimum soil temperatures, moisture, and fertility. They store carbon, provide diverse habitats for beneficial insects to support nearby crops, and they give shelter to our hens.⠀
⠀
#nationaltreeweek2020 @woodlandtrust #treesofinstagram #trees #treesforlife #agroforestry #carbonsequestration #savetheplanet #conservationagriculture #regenerativeagriculture #naturefriendlyfarming #wildlifefriendly #wildlifefriendlyfarming #smallscalefarming #organic #soilassociation #knowyourfarmer #suffolkproduce #suffolk #maplefarmkelsale

node.text:
Hello, wanted to focus on our #Farm8 salad mix comprising of cinnamon, Greek, Italian and local #basil, #dill, arugula and Lollo Rosso lettuce. One of the ways I enjoy it is like an open sandwich, rice cake being the base, the salad mix is topped with #Suki’s farm goat meat cooked in wine and rosemary. Dribbled with homemade sesame paste and sprinkled with #Vada Pav masala, (desiccated coconut, garlic and red chillies). It’s lip smacking good.

#regenerativefarming #smallscalefarming #foodsecurity #farmingfornature #supportlocal #nodigmarketgardening #chemicalfree

@tableandland 
#自給自足 #家庭菜園 #無農薬 #smallscalefarming #organic #ecofriendly #organicfarming #urbanfarming #organicfood #farming #産地直送 #都市農場 #都市農業 #野菜 #유기농 #陽明山

The kids enjoyed making these dried flower ornaments for the tree with some of the flowers and grasses I dried this fall. I have to say they look so lovely on the tree as well. 
I really wanted a very natural looking tree this year and I think we accomplished that. The kids and I have made some wonderful ornaments over the past few years and we have received some special ornaments over the years too. So, this year every ornament on the tree really has meaning and I absolutely love that. 
So, I guess the Christmas season has officially kicked off in our house!

The farm tour event that was held yesterday at @burnsideorganicfarm was just wonderful. Thanks so much to Lara, Jamie and Ned as well as @jemamccabe, Kate and Fede for taking the time out of your Sunday to show us all around. 

Thanks also to Kate at @ecokitchen_margaretriver, Tracey at @capealmonds and Sa at @dopemylk for being on hand to chat about your delicious locally grown and made products. 

Thank you too @local_is_more for sponsoring the event.

And a big thank you to everyone who came along. We hope you enjoyed the afternoon and came away with a better understanding and appreciation of just how much effort goes into growing good food well. 
.
.
.

How come Plant foods are just SO BEAUTIFUL?! I just adore them. 100% want to bring those into my body and let them become me ;)
(ok that sounded a little weird but you know what i mean ..!) 😆
.
Gorge produce this week from @nourishedcommunities – who, if you are local to #Islington, #London you’re lucky – these lovely peeps’ well-stocked popup shop open days are steadily increasing (think farm #marketstall + whole food shop + #zerowasteshop combined!)
.
I just love seeing small, passionate initiatives like these take foot and steadily grow stronger as people around them understand just how lucky they are to get access to this kind of produce. And just how much small businesses like these bring to a local area 👊 #shoplocalforthewin #londonlockdown2
.
Much love, Sara x
#shisodelicious

node.text:
Coming at ya Monday. I’ve got my list ready, coffee in the mug, and intent set on getting it done! 
•
It’s #meetmygoatmonday with @theyounghomestead 
•
For those of you who haven’t met him, this is Trevor. Trevor and his sister Annabelle are one year old Nigerian Dwarf goats. 
•

node.text: I’m a pickling newbie so this project took me all morning. It was a really fun morning though.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Natalie in Lüneburg, Germany. Image may contain: food.

node.text:
This week we are happy to share with you @sullifarmandkitchen 👩‍🌾 They strive to build community around food, to have relationships with the families that consume their product.  They want you to know where your food comes from, how it was produced, how it affects you, and how it affects the environment around you. 💛

@farmstandrevival’s NEWEST Featured Farm: 👍 @sullifarmandkitchen

“Here at Sullifarm, we embrace a rather full-circle scene in agriculture.  One that’s all about restoration, repair, healing and health.  We don’t just grow food, we strive to regenerate our soils and pastures in the process. 
.
Pasture-raising animals according to their natures thus creating the tastiest and healthiest food products in a local and regenerative farm setting.”

Hooks, TX
📸: @sullifarmandkitchen
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by 🍇Garden Community🍇 on November 26, 2020. Image may contain: outdoor.

node.text: We have been so busy getting the farm ready for winter but I’m happy to say we got the new greenhouse up and running right before the first snowfall of the season. It’s not perfect but I’m proud of how it came out and happy to have more space for our #microgreens 🌱Building a greenhouse from scratch was the easy part, growing in Tahoe during the winter will be the challenging part. 🌱🌱🌱 #HighAltitudeFarming
